text.section: The board shall, before revoking, suspending, or imposing probationary conditions on any license or registration issued pursuant to this chapter, or before issuing a written reprimand or imposing a fine, set the matter for a hearing to be conducted in accordance with KRS Chapter 13B.

After denying an application for a license or a registration for an apprentice, the board shall set the matter for a hearing in accordance with KRS Chapter 13B upon written request of the applicant if the request is made within thirty (30) days of the mailing of a letter of denial.
Any final order of the board may be appealed to Franklin Circuit Court in accordance with KRS Chapter 13B.

law.history: Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 149, sec. 8, effective July 15, 1996; and ch. 318, sec. 272, effective July 15, 1996. -- Amended 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 125, sec. 10, effective June 15, 1988. -- Created 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 82, sec. 5, effective July 13, 1984.
